bill_title: to revise the length of time financial responsibility must be maintained by certain persons to have driving privileges.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the length of time financial responsibility must be maintained by certain persons to have driving privileges. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-35-95 be amended to read as follows: 32-35-95. The Department of Commerce and Regulation shall , upon request , consent to the immediate cancellation of any bond or certificate of insurance, or the department shall direct and the state treasurer shall return to the person entitled thereto any money or securities deposited pursuant to this chapter as proof of financial responsibility, or the department shall waive the requirement of filing proof, in any of the following events: (1) At any time after three years from the date such proof was required when proof has been shown continuously for a one-year period from the reinstatement of the license and if during the three-year one-year period preceding the request, the department has not received record of a conviction or a forfeiture of bail which would require or permit the suspension or revocation of the license or registration of the person by or for whom such proof was furnished; or (2) In the event of the death of the person on whose behalf such proof was filed or the permanent incapacity of such person to operate a motor vehicle; or (3) In the event the person who has given proof surrenders his the person's license and registration to the department; or (4) Upon satisfying a judgment in full if the judgment debtor has received his a license and registration or nonresident's operating privilege pursuant to § 32-35-54 and has furnished proof of financial responsibility continuously for the last three years one year from the reinstatement date of the license . Section 2. That § 32-35-97 be amended to read as follows: 32-35-97. Whenever If any person whose proof has been canceled or returned under subdivision 32-35-95(3) applies for a license or registration within a period of three years from the date proof was originally required , any such application shall be refused unless the applicant shall reestablish reestablishes such proof for the remainder of such three-year period and maintains proof for a continuous one-year period from the reinstatement of the driver's license .
